meanings.sent1: The porosity of the sponge allows it to absorb water easily.
meanings.sent2: The rock's porosity determines how much water it can hold.
meanings.sent3: The cake's porosity was so high that it soaked up all the syrup in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The porosity of the soil was like a sponge, soaking in all the rainwater.
meanings.sent5: The porosity of the fabric made it perfect for breathable summer clothing.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being porous.
meanings.sent1: The porosity of the material made it ideal for filtration purposes.
meanings.sent2: The porosity of the ground affected how quickly the water drained.
meanings.sent3: The porosity of the cheese was so high that it crumbled easily.
meanings.sent4: The porosity of the wall allowed sound to travel through easily.
meanings.sent5: The porosity of the sponge was evident when it soaked up all the spilled juice.

meanings.definition: The extent to which a substance is porous.
meanings.sent1: The porosity of the foam determined its suitability for cushioning.
meanings.sent2: The porosity of the paper affected how quickly the ink dried.
meanings.sent3: The porosity of the bread made it perfect for soaking up the soup.
meanings.sent4: The porosity of the filter paper allowed the liquid to pass through.
meanings.sent5: The porosity of the rock was evident in how easily it absorbed oil spills.
